review_title: Solid Employment but Lacking Forward Vision and Culture
pros:
- Reliable conglomerate - you will never worry about if your paycheck is going to come through (if you've ever worked for a small business you will understand this concern)

- If you are in ops or ever spend actual time onsite or on a ride along, you will gain a much greater appreciation for how our cradle-to-grave materialistic society actually operates and the sheer amount of waste it produces

- Everyone that I worked with in both of my locations were honestly really nice people, there just wasn't much real cohesion or culture.

- Senior leadership is trying to pull the ship forward and implement more tech and sustainability.

- Lots of locations to transfer or get promoted to.

- Solid employee stock purchase options for a holding that will never really tank

- If you are located in Phoenix or are a higher up, free WMO tickets!
cons:
- Since the re-org at the beginning of last decade there are far fewer opportunities for promotion and you may be in a role for a long time before somebody either moves up, leaves, or dies.

- Not a lot of focus on continuous improvement or training+education, they just want you to hit your goal and stay in your same seat forever.

- This will mostly be a concern for younger people, but the company tends to lean towards middle-age employees and isn't always very lively and is lacking a vibrant office culture. Most locations will just feel like standard bland corporate fair.

- While senior leadership and the sustainability team are thinking about and working on how to transition our economy to one that produces less trash or 0 waste and recycles everything to create a cradle-to-cradle model, the area teams from the route managers to the vice presidents are not really in support of this vision. My manager would often ask me why I was trying to sell recycling accounts.

- As an outside rep you are pretty much doing things the exact same way that that position has operated probably since it has existed...drive around and walk into any business that doesn't have a green can. Waste Management has an unGODLY amount of data in their salesforce CRM and could leverage this so much more effectively to make more intelligent sales.

- Realizing how the financials in the waste business actually function may leave a bad taste in your mouth. They will offer competitive rates at first to win business, and from there on out will essentially pray that that company doesn't pay enough attention to their bill to realize they are getting reamed by price increases year over year. This basically means that instead of valuing long time customers they will gladly rip off churches, schools, etc. for 7, 8 , 9, 10 dollars a yard if they aren't vigilant over their own bill, know how to read the contract and fight it, or if they don't have a rate cap to start with.

- Waste Management is indeed the largest in the industry, but that is mainly because it makes very astute acquisitions (ie their recent purchase of Advanced Disposal) and performs savvy financial moves rather than actually having superior customer service, ops, reporting, or anything of real value to the customer to justify their high bill from WM for the exact same service that Republic or WCN or a solid local hauler could do for much less. WM will make just as many mistakes as those other companies and new service will always be a headache.

There is always work and ample overtime if one desires, it's a choice in Bradenton, they do not force anyone. With a 33% turnover rate, opportunities to move to different LOB are constantly available. More often than not, management will hear out any grievances, I personally haven't had any yet. It really is a great company to work for as long as you follow their rules.
cons: Vehicle maintenance can be long and drawn out. However, with a large fleet it can take time to get it right. Management can be wishy washy when addressing driver concerns. "Customer Perception" is an overused term. Especially when it's the same customers over and over again. Any real cons are easily addressed so this would not be a deal breaker for me.

review_title: Early on,WM was great,then too top heavy with unrealistic productivity goals and safety rules.
pros: Pay was fine. Benefits were one of the best in the industry. Benefits started to get expensive for a 11 Billion dollar a year company,though. Trucks were good,maintance was ok. At first,lots of room to improve your performence.
cons: Company has policy to report every injury, I did, thats why i am a former employee. Company made every effort to keep me from returning to work. Productivity manager didn't have CDL, but did ride along to tell us what we were doing wrong. Too much favoritism to special employees. Company has deep pockets for management. At end,one mechanic for 25 trucks. Unrealistic productivity goals, example- why i took 2 minutes longer to get to landfill compared to other driver. Getting hurt,then losing bonus AND percentage of raise. NOT FAIR.

review_title: ok company to work for, former diesel mechanic
pros: good benifits, somewhat dependable company, ok pay. some good co workers. and some bad.
cons: very large company so you're more like just a number to them. and this company is all about the numbers. how to get more out of their employees and pay less is number one  to them. this is also a very strict company.  and I've seen employees with 10-20 years invested in the company get fired or suspended for minor mistakes.  you are definitely replaceable to them. also their is a very high turnover rate for managers. at least where I was. also don't count on a real raise. in 2 years I got 35 cents. was promised a little more for each certification I got. and I never got a dime. so I eventually left.  Bottom line if you're looking for a solid job with benifits with a big company. it will do. but if you're looking for career advancement  or to stand out in this company it's hard to do. it's a place were you could end up doing the same exact job you were doing on day 1. for the next 20 years.

pros: I really enjoyed my time while working at Waste Management. The employees really care about going above and beyond for the customer, and it shows. And the supervisors/managers all work together so that everything runs seamlessly. The insurance and benefits plans are phenomenal. I would definitely recommend applying to anyone that is thinking about it!
cons: It can get repetitive occasionally, but so does every other job.

review_title: Great Company unless you're a sales representative.
pros: As with all outside sales jobs you have the freedom to plan your own day. You get a corporate credit card for expenses and they expect you to use it! Taking potential or existing customers out to lunch is a nice perk. Great name recognition and excellent customer service.
cons: Very demanding! Daily/monthly unattainable goals. This is an extremely cut-throat business. You get no commission if you don't make at least 50% of your goal and then only minimal commission until you reach 100% of your goal. You're constantly looking for those customers who are in the small window of opportunity to get out of their current contract with their current provider. You will work you butt off to get a $75.00 contract and may not even get the commission on it. They expect you to work for your base salary. There is a lot of turnover.

review_title: Waste Management offered me a challenging and rewarding position that allowed me to grow.
job_title: Facility Manager in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: I was a facility manager who took over a facility that had been without a dedicated manager for quite some time. During my time we improved operations, had multiple years of 100% safety, implemented new policies and felt as though I was part of team.
cons: Oklahoma does not have legislation supporting Electronics Recycling so it was no longer feasible to keep the Oklahoma plant open. Unfortunately I did not find this out from my direct supervisor but from the landlord. The reason I was provided with was that we had spent $7,000.00 more than the TX facility in the last year - that money was spent as a direct result of management wanting upgrades to my facility.

review_title: Stable company with opportunity to grow and learn.
pros: Good benefits and great people at WM. Most employees feel strongly about the company are proud of the work they do. The quality of leadership varies by area, but most leaders care about employees and customers. WM is the leader in the waste industry, so opportunities to grow and learn are constant. However, some people are happy doing the same job for 20 years, and there are plenty of people like that at WM too. The company is large enough to accommodate both.
cons: Pay is not always competitive in some areas. As stated above, sometimes the quality of leadership varies from location to location. So, if you have a poor leader, the work environment can be difficult. WM, like most companies, is always looking to cut costs, but sometimes they do so without understanding all of the ramifications involved.

pros: It was a great place to be given responsibility and authority to do a great job.  We did exciting things that saved millions of dollars and provided great job satisfaction.  My company overall rating for 10-15 years ago would have been 5 stars.
cons: The company changed over the years.  It went from the company I described in the "Pros" to one where employees were no longer the valued asset they once were.  The company took out one leg (employees) of the three-legged stool (customers, stockholders, employees) and left the remaining staff to try to get the job done short-handed and without much of the collective company/industry knowledge it had collected over the years.  The company struggles from year to year defining what it is and chooses eliminating heads as the answer to failed decision making at the leadership level.

review_title: Not bad, but not a great place at first glance.
pros:
Good people
Consistent work
Weekly pay
Safety lunches
A good boot allowance
cons:
Old falling apart equipment
Moving around to other sites
90 day wait for benefits. 
Long work days, and work weeks
Ridiculous Safety for safety sake.

job_title: Setup Coordinator in New Town, PA
pros: I loved my work, the pay was decent and I had hours that didn't change.
cons: There is a LOT of racism and not in the way you may think. If a white employee makes racist remarks, they are fired immediately. If a black employee makes remarks, it takes an 8 month investigation before they are talked to. Managers do not discipline fairly. If you buddy up to them, you do not get disciplined. Higher work loads are given to the people that actually work and those that don't do their jobs are not held accountable. The attendance policy is ridiculous. If you get sick and call out on a Monday or Friday, you are given a written warning. No raises-even to hard workers. Was promised promotion for a year but not given because they could not afford to let me out of my role. I was rewarded with my department being relocated across the country. There is no reward for extraordinary work. Disappointing at best. No overtime given when absolutely needed, causing customers to suffer. Company is failing quickly and the "restructuring" is making the lives of working employees horrible.

review_title: Not an employee first kind of company
pros: Some good benefits like 401k, stock purchase program, and healthcare.
cons: 13 days of PTO/year you’re first 5 years. At one point this included your sick days. If you’re considered corporate you get an extra 5 floating holidays. No tuition reimbursement. No paternity leave, you just use the PTO you have and it’s clearly not a lot of PTO to begin with. Working from home is up to your manager (And that was a no from my manager).

pros:
Work hard give 120% and after 10 to 20 or moore years. You will be in the same position             
maby $2 or $3 moore an hr whith 2 moore weeks vacation . It's the highest paying day care center in newengland .great place to work good luck.
cons: They will stalk you every minute you are on the clock.If your in cab cam goes off you will be written up for nose picking.So please use a tissue. You will be promised the world.Most unethical place to work .You will be treated as the trash you haul.Use them before they use you .

review_title: Horrible experience from the value of employee perspective.
pros: Good place to work at a good pay for awhile.  However, after time that becomes a liability and you are targeted to be let go to cut costs.
cons: Corporate has no clue how to solve problems in the field other than restructuring or letting people go to cut costs.

review_title: This has been going on for years, and getting worse.
pros:
Pay and benefits is better than any other driving job in the area.  

Helper positions have great pay and benefits and require only a strong back.  Education may be helpful, but not needed.
cons:
Things don't get fixed unless there's a problem.  You can see a problem on the horizon, point it out, but no actions are taken until it actually has any kind of negative effect.  

This includes maintenance of their fleet.  Good people just want to get their job done and go home, but they are constantly delayed because of mechanical  failures.  

There's also a culture with management where people feel like they have a target on their back.  It's not just work of get fired.  Many feel like they have to constantly make up for the poor decisions of management, by putting in longer days, more work, and running all day.

pros: The drivers are really good people, other than that, i can't think of one positive thing to say about WM.
cons: Extremely long hours (12-14hrs). Micromanagement to the highest level, poor training, unrealistic goals, and an overall poor work environment. WM will say its all about being safe but they hound the drivers about completing their routes at by a certain time (speed vs safety; conflicting agendas). The trucks break down frequently but as a route manager you are still responsible for making sure all routes get completed, while making sure no driver works more than 14 hrs a day or more than 57hrs per week. Often times when a truck breaks down, you won't know until the very last minute and chances are you won't have a viable spare truck. WM will say family is number one but in actuality, you will not have any kind of life. Your day will start at 3 am and you won't get off until about 4pm (or later). Even when you get home, you are still required to answer emails. The drivers are treated like modern day slaves.  WM is the worst company/organization I have ever worked for. I would not encourage anyone to work for this company not matter how desperate a person is for employment.

job_title: Inside Commercial Representative in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
My working hours were ideal. M-F. 
That is literally the ONLY problem I have
cons:
If you want to feel appreciated, don't work here.
The commission structure CONSTANTLY changes. And they are constantly lowering the cap. When I  left,  the cap was only 1/3 of what it was the year prior.  I worked commercial customers, then they made us start taking calls for residential customers. Policies and procedures are WAY different,  however we received  no training on it. 
Speaking of training... it is a joke.  After training there is no help on the floor except for your coworkers. And they get on trouble for helping you. 
The place is so micromanaged and it's such a stressful environment. And they fire people for the tiniest thing,  or fire GREAT employees over false accusations. The upper management lies and does NOT care about its employees.

job_title: Accountant I in Pompano Beach, FL
pros: They have a great workforce, the people that work there are some of the hardest working, loyal and talented people. Also due to size Waste Management is able to offer benefits that are better than most other companies.
cons: The ridiculous hours that have to be worked in order to hit deadlines. The amount of work is unrealistic to have any kind of balance between work and family. There is a big part of management support that is simply not there, especially in accounting where there is the greatest need. While the workforce is loyal, WM is not,  they just laid off close to 1,000 corporate employees and the area is believed to be next. Very little opportunity for advancement.

pros: Paid weekly, half decent benefits, safety bonuses, there is a good 401k plan. Profit sharing through an employee stock purchase plan.
cons:
The trucks are falling apart. The drivers write things to be fixed and have a hard time getting them taken care of. Many driver comfort items are overlooked as not safety sensitive. Air conditioning is a big necessity when working in hot humid conditions.  If a truck has A/C, it should work. 
It seems like everything is a big secret. The communication between the managers and drivers is lacking. Management seems more concerned about the bottom line. The drivers are the face of the company and management needs to do whatever it takes to make sure the drivers are happy. If the drivers are happy, the customer is happy.

pros: Both side cabs that is also not for every employee.
cons:
As I have said transport is not available for everyone in this company and if it is available make sure to get on the cab atleast 2hours before your shift timings. No matter you lives in gurgaon or in east delhi.
HR don’t care about anything and just try to make upper management happy even if the employee is giving the resign.
If you want to resign then for every small question you have to run to HR and they will answer in 3-4 days after contacting them again and again.
No food is available except the maggi and Parantha so i can’t say they have cafeteria.
Now for management- they only how to call everyone in meeting room for foolish reasons, you want to go home in half day you are in meeting room, you were talking to someone in little loud voice than you are in meeting room, you are coming late in companies transport you are in meeting room. I wish they will not call you for going to the washroom.
Management think all their employees are robots they will do double the work on single day without leaving the chair.
There are 100’s of more cons.

review_title: Sad day when you love your job and learn your call center is closing
job_title: Inside Commercial Representative in Oak Harbor, WA
pros: Love the call center reps - you work hard and put up with some tough customers.  Your a great team of people and it's sad to learn we will never be a team again.
cons: We were told this week our call center is closing.  It shocked and hurt 125 employees in a very small town.  We are so busy some of us are working OT everyday, until this week when the closing was released.  Now that they've routed our calls to AZ, the phones stopped ringing.  If we are going to stay open for another 3 months, how are we going to do our jobs when the phones stopped ringing.

pros: Safety focused environment. Good benefits/starting pay. Support team work.
cons: Micro-managed. Focus on problems and who to blame. Change procedures constantly. High turnover rate. Would rather hire and train new employees, than keep people who know what they are doing. Set impossible goals year to year. Think that every time a truck breaks down, it is preventable.  Focus on Safety but don't want to spend money on things to keep employees safe if they are too expensive. Spend a lot of money on new trucks but don't want to spend money on maintaining them. Focus daily on what employees do wrong and not what they do right.  Make policies so they fire whoever they want. Hire people at higher pay then employees that have been there for decades.

review_title: Really depends on your manager and line of business....stay away from recycling center.
pros: Great senior leadership and awesome pay.  This company is really trying to transform the trash and recycling business.  It would be nice to completely remove the days of drivers having to get out of truck (too many injuries & accidents).  I also like the Life Critical Rules...break one of these and you are history.  All of the life critical rules are a result of multiple employee and customer deaths over the years.
cons: A little frustrating to see your employees come into work and leave 4 hours later, with full 8 hours pay or an option to start working OT (union contracts).  Meanwhile, management is scheduled for a min. 10 hour day (when things are going well).

pros: The only good thing was meeting some outstanding individuals.
cons: Good old boy network.  Too many cheaters in sales who passed the buck concerning the customer service end who got compensated well for their sales while those of us who did handle customers concerns were passed up for promotions.   ICR Training shabby at best.  They take advantage of long term customers monetarily, especially seniors.

pros: steady job good people to work with we go the extra mile for our customers  just don't want to lose it
cons: got to watch what you report to hr  turn in upper management for conduct issue found in my favor now the one who got in trouble decides what i get paid a hour and has said i won't see top pay as long as they decide what i get even when company gives out raises and   made sure to say this when no one else was around to hear it

pros:
Benefits - whether union or as a WM employee, this company takes care of you.
Work-Life balance - minus the expected 10 hour shifts, once you are done for the day, you are done.  Only the DOM or DM will handle outside the working hour requests/needs.
Company work vehicle with fuel card to boot
cons: High expectations with safety.  Most make sense, but a few remain to be discussed.  Having a camera in your work truck, monitoring your every movement and activity can add to a commute, should you have one long enough to increase your risk of a "drive cam" event.

review_title: Why do you have to take from us ?
pros: I really can't say anymore!
cons: Mico managed, never thanked, just asked what took you so long, no raise, the trucks are old and embarrassing to drive, our insurance is going up, trucks break down they never have no parts you get stuck driving some real crap holes in the floor heaters don't work smoke gets in the cab and you smell not to mention the head ache from it the smell and with dealing with all of that the stress is really high they have all these new employees who are placed in orange baton duty in the morning they are puppets for management to say our employees are happy they don't know nothing about this place how much we have lost this was a good place to work and now its going down thanks for donating my turkey this year and taking my raise away don't worry gas went up food went up! Even our CEO's bonus keeps going up thanks boss!

review_title: High pressure, high demand.  Your best is never good enough.
pros: The co-workers are nice and pleasant people.  Field management is a pleasure to work with.  You will be exposed to different projects and you learn a lot in a short amount of time.  The benefits are good.  Not bad if you want to spend a short time and move on to a better place.  Afterall, it's a Fortune 200.
cons: You give an inch, the management wants a foot.  The work pressure is overwhelming.  Don't expect a promotion either, they always hire externally even when there is qualified people in house.  Morale is low and there are a lot of disgruntled employees.

pros: Friendly recruiters.. closed on Sundays and most holidays.  Competitive salaries for management roles.  Really great talent peppered across this organization.
cons: Having worked in other call centers, this place has some of the worst culture Ive ever witnessed.  The VP/Director has been here too long(35 years), she has no clue what's happening with people below her.  Managers are grasping at straws to try and stop the quitting... even attendance awards!!  There seems to be a lot of restructuring and some employees are allowed to do whatever they want while the (in my opinion) very rude HR lady decides who she does and doesn't like.  To boot, they've had two shooter threats in the last 6 months!!! What could be so bad about talking to people about trash that makes someone want to do that?  It's the management above the supervisors that are totally incompetent.

review_title: Company pretends to care and appreciate
job_title: Customer Experience Representative in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Convienently located, call center experience, appreciation attempts such as raffles and giveaways (although poorly executed). Honestly, good experience for your resume but not a career growth company.
cons: Upper management has no idea what they are doing. Managers do what they think should happen without knowing how anything on the floor works. They have supervisors provide little information to workers. Supervisors are hired from out instead of promoted which leads to supervisors who know NOTHING about what agents on the floor need help with.

review_title: Great Benefits, Highly Political Interoffice Bureaucracy
job_title: Strategic Account Manager in Hartford, CT
pros: Great 401k matching and plan, ESPP stock plan is a deal, health and dental aren't bad. Remote working is allowed in some cases.
cons: WM is a huge company, so people can have vastly different experiences.  I reported to an office out of  Connecticut.  If you weren't one of the favorites of the leadership team of that division, your career was dead.  You weren't going anywhere.  The leader of the group is a smart guy who can execute, but he and his inner circle have some silly ideas that they want validated by a chorus of 'yes-men.'  Bottom-line:  If you can handle faking it and pretending to like terrible ideas and inefficient processes for the decent pay and benefits, then go for it.  If you have to speak your mind, work somewhere else because you wont' last long.

pros: The drivers and the front line employees are amazing.
cons:
The management team truly does not care about their people.  It is all about the EBIT(A) and they will do whatever it takes to achieve it.  Buildings are in disrepair and in some cases unsafe to work in. Management drives results through bullying, sarcasm and fear.  The upper management team including HR enjoy gossiping about other employees and are rude and sarcastic to people both during meetings and behind their backs in front of other employees.

Corporate drives initiatives down without ever seeing the front line and how they are impacting them.  As a result many areas operate outside of policy.

pros: Large company; good systems for training, its not going anywhere - no risk of jobs being exported to China or Mexico.
cons: WM is in crisis with how to approach the Recycling business model.  The municipal contracts are tied to hauling (which makes money) and the belief that recovered recyclable can be sold for more than the cost of collection and sorting.  but the recycling cannot exist on its own.  Its revenue/costs then have to be blended in with hauling operations creating animosity throughout..

review_title: Doesn't employ Americans! Ships jobs to India!

Work environment is depressing and everyone is very unhappy. They send jobs that aren't customer facing to India and lay off Americans. So much for an American company.

Great pay and benefits

review_title: SMB B2B hunter role, tenacity required, self starters, strict sink or swim mentality, high intensity, ABC's

pros: Little to no interference from Management you are free to run your day as if you run the business yourself. Great pay. Fun and lively work environment. Best place to make friends at work. Highly supportive peer system.
cons: Little to no training or ongoing support from management with individuals whom are struggling to meet goals. Stress over job security when not meeting sales quotas. Internal applicants need not apply for management without having a relevant degree. Lack of consistency in enforcement of policies/procedures. Lack of sound judgment or decision making when changes are implemented or needed. Stubborn Management unwilling to accept any form of criticism be it constructive or otherwise indifferent.

pros: Great co-workers that are excellent at what they do. Overall, the company has a strong reputation and relative job security. Innovative techologies are coming down the line making WM a potentially exciting place to work in the next 3 - 5 years.
cons: Too many layers in management, with little recognition to those who deserve it, a lot of "change" with little to no guidance or explaination of new roles/responsibilities; you must be be okay with ambiguity. Pay is also lower than comparable positions elsewhere.

pros: Great Pay, Great Benefits, Great Managers in Operations
cons:
We are paid on our performance with things that are outside our control. For example:

They are never prepared for weather. They are literally towing trucks in and out so they can dump their loads. This happens way too often. A driver should not be held accountable for their lack of preparation.

review_title: Caution: you may not want job after reading.

review_title: Waste Management is growing at a fast pace, but forgets to invest in their own people that are helping it grow.
job_title: Roll Off Dispatcher in Houston, TX
pros: Management is helpful and will go to support your decision making as long is it makes logical sense and is in line with company goals.  In operations specifically, you are the brain of the company and the everyday workload can be challenging and engaging.
cons: The operations department of this company has employees that are some of the most knowledgeable  within the company, but there are constant silly  errors by the customer service and corporate departments that require fixing by operations or else they will adversely affect the customers and clients.  Time off is not good, it requires you be employed at two years in order to receive a full two weeks off of paid vacation.  Operations often works long hours and weekends.

review_title: This company has the most potential for innovation and sustainability.

cons: Senior management that does not fully understand the complexities of the field and the resources needed to meet goals and profitability.  A disconnect between the Market Area and the other divisions within WM.  Management systems in compliance are not fully developed for all divisions.

job_title: Heavy Equipment Operator II in Richland, SC
pros:
401k, stock and benefits  Overtime is good

You might think I need to change title at top after you read this. I love my job just wish WM will open their eyes and see the things going wrong in this company.

review_title: I was with WM for over 16 years; for the most part they are a great company;  however ...
pros: Good pay, opportunities there for those that can be persistent; local management very good and understanding when comes to personal time and family.
cons: Unfortunately the customer must realize that, for the most part, you get what you pay for - generally, great service.  I have to reiterate the last several comments above about management and their need for increasing rates to satisfy corporate office and Wall St. It all puts a strain on employees and lower management whom have to speak to the customers day in and day out about a 2nd price increase within a 12 month period.

pros: Very complete on-boarding and training process. Trainers and management have a coaching mindset and very solid belief in continuous improvement. I felt really well supported from my first day, through my training period, and every week since. Although WM is a really massive company, I completely feel like they are invested in my success here and care about helping me develop as a professional.
cons: There is an enormous amount of details to learn about the waste industry. Although I learned a lot in my training period, it was not until I actually started working with customers and using the systems that I began to feel competent. There are lots of different systems to learn in order to do my job, and it has taken about six months for me to feel like "I get it".

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Franklin, TN
pros: No weekend work and normal holidays
cons:
The training was not consistent. Should have onsite trainer to teach a full 12 weeks. They tested me on information prior to teaching it. They did not address age and sexual orientation discrimination. They allowed bullying via social media by co workers. They have strict guidelines about cell phones at the desk and yet everyone has them out constantly.  Not great for customer confidentiality!
They have extensive recycling program for customers and even trademarked “go green” however none of their locations actually recycle themselves, it goes to a landfill. They go over how to save customers but the supervisors state they don’t care if the customer cancels. I had two customer compliments in two weeks time during my phone time, which is a rarity.  However, they didn’t invest in me.  They do not truly care for the customer.  The atmosphere was toxic.

review_title: Very stressful, and intimidating is the atmosphere at this company!

cons: the drivers are the lowest on the totempole, and they do all of the work, and are paid.  That is it.  there is way to many managers and office personel.   20 years ago we had more customers (WORK), more drivers, and one tenth of the management team.  we were a fortune 500 company back then.  our job is very dangerous and difficult, but that is ok.  It is the managers that will say and do anything for their bonuses, that spoil the workplace atmosphere.

job_title: Roll Off Driver in Atlanta, GA

cons: Everything, where do I even start. First thing is the pay which is 14.03. CAMERAS IN THE TRUCKS FACING THE DRIVER AND THE ROAD. They use the cameras against you like you're a convicted felon on probation. Almost every driver is currently looking for a job to get away.

review_title: Bad leadership, bad management, empty corporate vision - Dissapointing!

The highest performing employees are consistently overworked, underpaid, undervalued and unappreciated. Weak employees receive the same compensation, if not better, than those who work 10 times as hard and more often than they do. Work life balance varies wildly from employee to employee, with lazier employees leaving on time every day by pawning off their work onto the closers who are then obligated to complete it or else answer for everyone else's mistakes. Employees who are very good and exceed at their jobs are routinely punished by being given more work and responsibilities whilst not receiving any raises or gratitude. This applies to dispatchers AND drivers. 

The remote relationships dispatchers have with their route managers are often strained and adversarial. There is a general negativity around the office, generated by the laziest employees constantly fighting and bickering and complaining about how their job is harder than everyone else's and how they are most invaluable. It's quite bizarre and juvenile and pathetic.  Employees who know which fellow employees work hardest and have the most responsibilities will treat them with aloofness and resentment. Fellow employees often conspire against others to land them in trouble or to get them punished, over some kind of envy or a petty squabble or whatever else. Incompetent employees rarely get disciplined by management, and overall there is almost an incentive to underperform because there is no benefit to exceeding expectations and excelling at what you do.  It's painfully obvious that doing the very barest minimum while a small handful of people pick up your slack will not get you fired, or even in trouble. It's so weird that it almost seems as if WM has a masochistic desire to push their best employees AWAY from the company by kicking them around constantly and using and abusing them until they have burned out while coddling relatively worthless other employees indefinitely.

Management, while polite and generally kind, will just demand more and more of you if you can handle everything they throw at you and you'll get nothing in return.

Upward mobility feels hopeless and unobtainable once you have become irreplaceable in your current role and the only thing that can breed is discontentment and apathy. 

From the top down, WM does a very good job of making sure all the middling employees on the frontlines of making this company efficient have no value and are absolutely replaceable. Jim Fish and co. are very transparent that they only care about profit over people and that they have little to no care about what happens to their underlings. You are merely a cog in this company.
